lines.content: Welcome to **Nimbus**, a lightweight CLI task manager (inspired by the Duke project) that helps you track tasks quickly from the terminal. Nimbus supports adding tasks, listing them, and marking/unmarking completion ‚Äî with a clean, consistent text UI.
- `unmark <index>` ‚Äî mark a task as not done
Nimbus prints responses in a consistent ‚Äúboxed‚Äù format for readability.
> Note: Nimbus is currently a **CLI (text UI)** application. Features like GUI and auto-saving should only be listed if you have implemented them.
1. Open the project folder in IntelliJ.
(Your original template instructions were here ‚Äî you can keep or delete that section depending on how ‚Äúpersonal‚Äù you want the README to be.)
Template reminder: keep `src/main/java` as the root folder for Java files. :contentReference[oaicite:1]{index=1}
### Run from Terminal (if Gradle wrapper exists)

private void showAdded(Task task, int count) {
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println("Now you have " + count + " tasks in the list.");
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list:");
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
System.out.println("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:");
private final Task[] tasks = new Task[MAX_TASKS];
